body.p:
Lexington Augt 27th 1863
To his Excelency
Governor Robinson
Dear Sir

I do not know that you remember me. but I know you and have been at your hospitable Mansion in Georgetown some years since with Mrs Higgins and others I am a son of R. S. Todd deceased whom no doubt you knew well. I write and would be pleased if you would confer on me the office of Notary Public for Fayette County it was conferred on me by Gov. Morehead without Solicitation during his reighn and I never sought ^it^ Afterwards
having at the time an idea of leaving the State. I can give the best of references if required -- the Secretary of State Knows me well. Mr. D C Wickliffe. I would be pleased to hear from you at your conveniance with all respect I remain

Your obt svt
Levi O. Todd

Fayette Co
L. O. Todd
Notary
Appd Aug 26. 1863
